sn35.151:4.1: “Mendicants, this spiritual life is lived without a resident student and without a teaching master.
sn35.151:4.2: A mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.
sn35.151:4.3: A mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.
sn35.151:4.4: And how does a mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master live in suffering and discomfort?
sn35.151:4.5: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eye, bad, unwholesome phenomena arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.
sn35.151:4.6: Those qualities reside within. Since they have bad unwholesome qualities residing within,
sn35.151:4.7: they’re said to have a resident student.
sn35.151:4.8: Those qualities master them. Since they’re mastered by bad unwholesome qualities,
sn35.151:4.9: they’re said to have a teaching master.
sn35.151:5.1: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.151:6.1: cognizes a phenomenon with the mind, bad, unwholesome phenomena arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.
sn35.151:6.2: Those qualities reside within. Since they have bad unwholesome qualities residing within,
sn35.151:6.3: they’re said to have a resident student.
sn35.151:6.4: Those qualities master them. Since they’re mastered by bad unwholesome qualities,
sn35.151:6.5: they’re said to have a teaching master.
sn35.151:6.6: That’s how a mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.
sn35.151:7.1: And how does a mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master live in happiness and comfort?
sn35.151:7.2: When a mendicant sees a sight with the eye, bad, unwholesome phenomena don’t arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.
sn35.151:7.3: Those qualities don’t reside within. Since they don’t have bad unwholesome qualities residing within,
sn35.151:7.4: they’re said to not have a resident student.
sn35.151:7.5: Those qualities don’t master them. Since they’re not mastered by bad unwholesome qualities,
sn35.151:7.6: they’re said to not have a teaching master.
sn35.151:8.1: Furthermore, when a mendicant hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.151:9.1: cognizes a phenomenon with the mind, bad, unwholesome phenomena don’t arise: memories and thoughts prone to fetters.
sn35.151:9.2: Those qualities don’t reside within. Since they don’t have bad unwholesome qualities residing within,
sn35.151:9.3: they’re said to not have a resident student.
sn35.151:9.4: Those qualities don’t master them. Since they’re not mastered by bad unwholesome qualities,
sn35.151:9.5: they’re said to not have a teaching master.
sn35.151:9.6: That’s how a mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.
sn35.151:9.7: This spiritual life is lived without a resident student and without a teaching master.
sn35.151:9.8: A mendicant who lives with a resident student and a teaching master lives in suffering and discomfort.
sn35.151:9.9: A mendicant who lives without a resident student and a teaching master lives in happiness and comfort.”
